questions.question_text:
A project is in the start-up phase of the project life cycle. The project team consists of 20 people from five different countries. The project team is scheduled to have quarterly face-to-face meetings. However, due to unforeseen circumstances, no face-to-face meetings can occur. The project manager is concerned that the team may not be able to fulfill their individual roles without face-to-face meetings.
What should the project manager do in this situation?

choices.B: Use the contingency reserve and subcontract the work.
choices.A: Utilize virtual teams for meetings and deliverables.
choices.C: Review the risk register for this unforeseen circumstance.
choices.D: Ask for an extension of time on the project deliverables.

discussion.content: Unforeseen circumstances are not part of the risk register, otherwise they would not be called UNforeseen circumstances. As a response to the unforeseen circumstance, which is an issue and not a theoretical risk anymore, an approriate response is virtual meetings

The question should be what the PM should do if face-to-face meeting is not an option anymore. The PM should review the risk register and see what the risk response is.
